articles.author: SAM METZ and MOSA'AB ELSHAMY
articles.description: AMIZMIZ, Morocco (AP) — People in Morocco slept in the streets of Marrakech for a third straight night as soldiers and international aid teams in trucks and helicopters began to fan into remote mountain towns hit hardest by a historic earthquake.
articles.title: Moroccans sleep in the streets for 3rd night following an earthquake that took more than 2,100 lives

articles.author: JOSH BOAK and AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: HANOI, Vietnam (AP) — President Joe Biden said Sunday his visit to Vietnam to showcase stronger ties with Hanoi was not about trying to start a “cold war” with China, but rather was part of a broader effort to provide global stability by building U.S.
articles.title: Biden says US outreach to Vietnam is about providing global stability, not containing China

articles.author: JENNIFER PELTZ
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Americans are looking back on the horror and legacy of 9/11, gathering Monday at memorials, firehouses, city halls and elsewhere to observe the 22nd anniversary of the deadliest terror attack on U.S.
articles.title: The United States marks 22 years since 9/11, from ground zero to Alaska

articles.author: JENNIFER SINCO KELLEHER
articles.description: LAHAINA, Hawaii (AP) — Ambulance and fire truck sirens wailed outside as Elsie Rosales stripped linens from king-sized mattresses at a beachfront resort in Lahaina.She tried to focus on the work, but was beset by dread: Had a wildfire taken the home she scrimped to buy on a housekeeper’s wages?
articles.title: Lahaina's fire-stricken Filipino residents are key to tourism and local culture. Will they stay?

articles.author: SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: CAIRO (AP) — A drone attack Sunday on an open market south of Sudan's capital, Khartoum, killed at least 43 people, activists and a medical group said, as the military and a powerful rival paramilitary group battle for control of the country.
articles.title: A drone attack on an open market has killed at least 43 people in Sudan as rival troops battle

articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Two foreign aid workers were reportedly killed in eastern Ukraine on Sunday as Russian shelling hit a van carrying a team of four working with a Ukrainian nongovernmental organization, while dozens of Russian drones targeted Kyiv and wounded at least one civilian.
articles.title: Russian strikes on Ukraine kill 2 foreign aid workers and target Kyiv

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Michael White had only recently arrived in a grim Iranian jail when a curious fellow prisoner, an English-speaking Iranian, approached him in the courtyard for a conversation.
articles.title: A US Navy veteran got unexpected help while jailed in Iran. Once released, he repaid the favor

articles.author: JOSEPH WILSON
articles.description: BARCELONA, Spain (AP) — Luis Rubiales, the suspended head of the Spanish soccer federation, finally folded under immense pressure Sunday and resigned three weeks after his kiss of a player on the lips overshadowed Spain’s first-ever Women’s World Cup title.
articles.title: Rubiales resigns as Spain's soccer president 3 weeks after kissing player at Women's World Cup final

articles.author: YUCHENG TANG
articles.description: BANGKOK (AP) — Xinyu Wen traveled to Thailand in June, planning a two-week vacation around Bangkok's Pride parade.
articles.title: Thailand's LGBTQ+ community draws tourists from China looking to be themselves

articles.description: HONOLULU (AP) — Kilauea, one of the most active volcanoes in the world, began erupting Sunday after a two-month pause, displaying glowing lava that is a safe distance from people and structures in a national park on the Big Island.
articles.title: Hawaii volcano Kilauea erupts after nearly two months of quiet
